result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Filed by Prosecutor. Date: April 18, 2022 at 1:15 pm, Br 1.
Agency Case No.: P22-01687
Hearing on April 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:09 PM Defendant Laura Michelle Sain appears by video from the Portage County Jail. Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Atty Andrew Mutchler. Atty Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant Laura Sain, in court.
Atty Mutchler calls the case and states the appearances.

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of possession of methamphetamine, possession of drug paraphernalia, possession schedule 2 narcotics, and 2 counts of felony bail jumping.
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner states objections to bond as stated on record.
Atty Bergner requests a signature bond.
Hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
